intro: Angadenia pandurata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandbur, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces distinctive burrs that aid in seed dispersal by attaching to the fur of animals. Angadenia pandurata is often found in coastal regions and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
